snippet: A proposal to erect two buildings containing 700 apartments overlooking the Gowanus Canal has made some residents apprehensive about living in the next big neighborhood.
abstract: Proposal by developer Lightstone Group to erect two buildings containing 700 apartments overlooking the Gowanus Canal has divided the Brooklyn neighborhood; some residents are trying to block or reduce the scale of the proposed towers, while others argue that the development would create a constituency to lobby for continuing the cleanup of the 1.8-mile canal itself, which was declared a Superfund site in 2010.
lead_paragraph: A proposal to erect two buildings containing 700 apartments overlooking the Gowanus Canal has made some residents apprehensive about living in the next big neighborhood.

headline.seo: Development Plan Near Gowanus Superfund Site Is Scorned and Celebrated
headline.main: Grand Plan for a Toxic Site Is Scorned and Celebrated
headline.print_headline: Grand Plan for a Toxic Site Is Scorned and Celebrated
